snippet: As the deadline for the nuclear talks approached, Secretary of State John Kerry signaled the need to return to Washington for top-level consultations.
abstract: Sec of State John Kerry, reporting after three days of intensive talks in Iran, says tangible progress has been made in negotiations on nation's nuclear program; will return to Washington to consult with Pres Obama about extending imminent deadline for final agreement.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and DAVID E. SANGER

lead_paragraph: As the deadline for the nuclear talks approached, Secretary of State John Kerry signaled the need to return to Washington for top-level consultations.

headline.main: Kerry Cites ‘Progress’ in Iran Talks but Says ‘Very Real Gaps’ Remain
headline.print_headline: Kerry Cites ‘Progress’ in Iran Nuclear Talks, but Says ‘Very Real Gaps’ Remain
